Authors:
Chada Norphanphoun, Sinang Hongsanan, Jayarama D. Bhat,
Chang-Hsin Kuo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
A new species of Alternaria associated with leaf blight of
Ficus Sp. and leaf spot of Kandelia Candel in Taiwan
Keywords:
1 new species, Mangroves, Microfungi, Morphology,
Pathogen, Phylogenetic analyses, Pleosporaceae, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Alternaria comprises saprobic and pathogenic species on a
large number of plants. The genus is currently divided into 28 sections
based on phylogenetic and morphological evidence. Alternaria formosana
sp. nov. associated with leaf blight of Ficus sp. and leaf spot of
Kandelia candel in mangroves in Taiwan is introduced based on
phylogenetic analyses and morphological characters. The new species is
characterized by macronematous conidiophores, sympodial, polytretic
conidiogenous cells and obclavate to obovoid, muriform conidia gradually
tapering towards beaked apex. Phylogenetic analysis of combined ITS,
LSU, SSU, and EF1Î± sequence data supports the placement of the new
species in Alternaria section Alternaria.
